remarks: If a unit element lies in the kernel of a ring homomorphism, then ` 0 = 1 ` , i.e. the target ring is the zero ring.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-Oct-2017.)
statement:
kerunit.1 $e |- U = ( Unit ` R ) $.
kerunit.2 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` S ) $.
kerunit.3 $e |- .1. = ( 1r ` S ) $.
kerunit $p |- ( ( F e. ( R RingHom S ) /\ ( U i^i ( `' F " { .0. } ) ) =/= (/) ) -> .1. = .0. ) $.
